intro: Calpicarpum, commonly known as the mountain ash or European rowan, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Rosaceae. It consists of several species, with Calpicarpum maximowiczii being one of the more notable ones. These plants are typically deciduous shrubs or small trees, characterized by their bright red berries and compound leaves. They are native to temperate regions of Europe, Asia, and North America. The berries are often used in traditional medicine and as a source of ornamental value in gardens.
